instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Three beeps.
threads.message:
As in subject, board just gives three ram beeps.

If I heat up around <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>, the board works fine until it cools down again.

When hot, I get power at L5550 & <CAPACITOR>C1724</CAPACITOR>, as soon as it cools though, no power there.

<CAPACITOR>C7602</CAPACITOR>::2 measures 0.000 in diode mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Three beeps.
threads.message: If <CAPACITOR>C7602</CAPACITOR> was really shorted it would fry <RESISTOR>R7601</RESISTOR> of course. What is L5550?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Three beeps.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 23957"]If <CAPACITOR>C7602</CAPACITOR> was really shorted it would fry <RESISTOR>R7601</RESISTOR> of course. What is L5550?[/QUOTE]

Sorry, I mean L7550

<RESISTOR>R7601</RESISTOR> seems to measure correctly at 2.2ohms.


Edit: I don't think <CAPACITOR>C7602</CAPACITOR> is shorted, I think something on the ::2 side is shorted. If I put the probe on ::1 I get a mostly normal reading.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Three beeps.
threads.message:
Uhm, please look at pin 2 of <CAPACITOR>C7602</CAPACITOR> and tell me where that is going....

If it beeps is there 1.35V on L7630? If yes then this thing has either bad RAM or cracked balls/traces which is pretty hopeless on these.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Three beeps.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 24016"]Uhm, please look at pin 2 of <CAPACITOR>C7602</CAPACITOR> and tell me where that is going....[/quote]

It's not entirely my fault Duke. Those three backlight Airs have me drinking at my desk!!!!

[quote]
If it beeps is there 1.35V on L7630? If yes then this thing has either bad RAM or cracked balls/traces which is pretty hopeless on these.[/QUOTE]

No, it has 1.06v both when it beeps and when I bake it a little and it boots.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Three beeps.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Three beeps.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="MDY, post: 24050"]When boots goes to 1.35V?[/QUOTE]

I will check again, but I think it's always at 1.06v
